member.name: T:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.ConsoleDisplayOption
member.summary: Supported log levels for ILogger devices

member.name: F:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.ConsoleDisplayOption.StartNormally
member.summary: Start the console as an application window that is visible on screen.

member.name: F:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.ConsoleDisplayOption.StartMinimized
member.summary: Start the console as an application window minimized to the task bar..

member.name: F:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.ConsoleDisplayOption.NoConsole
member.summary: No visible console window.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.SimulatorController.GetXMLProfileCamera(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets a copy of the profile. This is returned as a string value in the standard Response Value field.

remarks.para: This method returns the version of the ASCOM device interface contract to which this device complies. Only one interface version is current at a moment in time and all new devices should be built to the latest interface version. Applications can choose which device interface versions they support and it is in their interest to support previous versions as well as the current version to ensure they can use the largest number of devices.

member.param: Zero based device number as set on the server (A uint32 with a range of 0 to 4294967295)
member.response: Transaction complete or exception

response.examples: Error message describing why the command cannot be processed

member.response: Method or parameter value error, check error message

response.examples: Error message describing why the command cannot be processed

member.response: Server internal error, check error message

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.Program.StartBrowser(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts the system default handler (normally a browser) for local host and the current port.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.Program.CreateHostBuilder(System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a asp.net host builder. Sets the content root if a bundled application.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.Program.WriteAndLog(System.String)
member.summary: Writes to the console and logs to the primary log provider at the informational level.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.Program.ShowConsole(ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.ConsoleDisplayOption)
member.summary: Shows, minimises or hides the console window (Windows only)

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.Program.ConsoleWindowsState(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Return the state of the window with the supplied handle
member.param: Windows handle of the window to check.
member.returns: A value describing the current window state.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.WindowsNative.FindWindow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return the Windows handle of the windows with the supplied title
member.param: Class name of the windows or null
Title of the window or null
member.returns: Windows handle (hWnd) of the window if found or zero if not found

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.WindowsNative.ShowWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the visibility state of the window with the given handle

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.WindowsNative.IsWindowVisible(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determine whether a window is hidden or visible in some fashion
member.returns: True if the window is visible in some way (minimised, maximised or normal window) or false if it is hidden.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Simulators.WindowsNative.IsIconic(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determine whether a window is minimised
member.returns: True if the window is minimised or false if it is not.
